text:
The response to the
State of the Union.
“Good evening.”

It’s a high-stakes —
and sometimes awkward —

job for
rising political stars.
This year, the response

will be delivered
by Stacey Abrams.
“Every vote gets counted.”
So who is she,

and what does the choice tell
us about the Democratic Party?

“Change comes.
Success comes.”

Abrams is a lifelong
activist and a lawyer.

“— as a young woman,
as a young black woman.”

She worked her way up
the political ladder,

most recently serving
as minority leader

for the Georgia House
of Representatives.
“Thank you, Mr. Speaker.”

In 2018, her
progressive campaign

for governor electrified
the Democratic Party.

Abrams’s strategy involved
registering thousands
of new minority voters.
But it wasn’t enough to win.

Her opponent, Brian Kemp,
still came out ahead.

“I’m moving forward
and looking forward
to governing our great state.”

Since then, Abrams has
continued her efforts

to try and change how
elections work in the state.

“We had thousands
of Georgians who

were purged from
the rolls wrongly.”

She even brought her message to
Georgians with this Super Bowl ad.

“Every vote
should be counted,

from every corner
of our state.”

Abrams will be the first
black woman

and nonsitting public official
to give the rebuttal.

Her selection tells us
how Democratic leaders
see the future.
“She’s an incredible leader.

She knows what working people,
middle-class people,
go through.”

After a lot of debate over
whether to play to the center,

or embrace a more progressive
and diverse group of voters,

with Abrams, the party appears
to be courting the latter.

These voters
delivered Democrats

control of the House
in 2018,

a victory the party is eager
to repeat in 2020.
